title: Existing and planned dams by country

markdown.headingText: Existing and planned dams by country
markdown.markdown:
![](images/dams_risk_text.png) ::: {.content-container} Across Africa, there are over 1,200 existing dams, with 600 more proposed or under construction. However, 90% of Environmental Impact Assessments completely ignore the impacts of dams have on schistosomiasis and other water-borne diseases. ::: ::: {.banner .banner-1} ::: {.banner-content} ::: {.banner-image}
![](images/Talya_dams_a.png)
::: ::: {.banner-text} Existing and planned dams in Africa by country as of 2019. Existing dam data is taken from the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) database. Planned dam data is taken from the Global Dam Watch Future Hydropower Reservoirs and Dams database. ::: ::: ::: ::: {.content-container} Without proper risk assessment, these infrastructure projects inadvertently create perfect breeding grounds for disease-carrying snails which results in new transmission hotspots that trap entire communities in cycles of poverty and disease. ::: ::: {.banner .banner-1} ::: {.banner-content} ::: {.banner-text} ### Schistosomiasis endemicity Schistosomiasis endemicity in Africa by district in 2023. Schistosomiasis data is taken from the Expanded Special Project for the Elimination of Neglected Tropical Diseases (ESPEN). ::: ::: {.banner-image}
![](images/Talya_dams_b.png)

Water-related disease patterns before and after the construction of the Diama dam in northern Senegal.
